document.heading: The Right of Kiowa Voters to Vote by Mail Act of 2022
document.text: At a duly called session of the Legislature of the Kiowa Tribe held this 27th day of July, 2022, the following resolution and law were adopted.

recital.text: The Legislature is vested with the authority to pass laws and resolutions pursuant to Article VI, Section 6 (a) of the Constitution of the Kiowa Tribe, and

The CFR Court recently held that Kiowa Tribe Election Commission is not permitted to mail out ballots to all enrolled adult members of the Kiowa Tribe despite doing so in the two most recent elections; and,

The Legislature wishes to ensure that all adult members of the Tribe who maintain a current address with the Tribe receive a ballot by mail in all elections, notwithstanding any law, ordinance, or resolution of the Tribe to the contrary and/or previously enacted by the Tribe.
that the Legislature hereby enacts the attached law entitled, "THE RIGHT OF KIOWA VOTERS TO VOTE BY MAIL ACT OF 2022".

procedural-data.heading: CERTIFICATION
procedural-data.text: The foregoing resolution KL-CY-2022-012, was duly voted upon by the Legislature on July 27, 2022, at a Legislative Special Session I with a vote of (5) in favor and (0) opposed, (0) abstaining, and (0) absent, pursuant to the authority vested in the Legislature by the Constitution of the Kiowa Tribe.

procedural-data.text: Resolution No. KL-CY-2022-012 was presented to the Chairman of the Kiowa Tribe on the 27th day of July, 2022, pursuant to the Article VI, Section 8(a)(iv) of the Constitution of the Kiowa Tribe, and will become effective after signature by the Chairman or veto override by the Legislature, and as otherwise required by the Constitution.

section.heading: Short Title
section.text: This enactment shall be known as the "The Right of Kiowa Voters to Vote by Mail Act of 2022" ("Act").

section.heading: Purpose
section.text: The purpose of this Act is to authorize the Kiowa Election Commission to mail out ballots in all elections to all adult members of the Kiowa Tribe who maintain a current address to the Tribe, notwithstanding any law, ordinance, or resolution of the Tribe to the contrary and/or previously enacted by the Tribe.

para.text: Right of all adult Kiowa Tribal Members to vote is a fundamental component of democracy.
Fair and impartial elections are critical to guarantee the peoples right to choose their representation and to be governed by them.
In response to a recent BIA/CFR Court Order, the Legislature finds the need to solidify and guarantee the right of all Kiowa Tribal voters to receive a ballot by mail to all elections.

The Legislature hereby authorizes and directs the Kiowa Tribe Election Commission to mail out ballots to all adult members of the Kiowa Tribe who maintain a current address with the Tribe in all elections, notwithstanding any law, ordinance, or resolution of the Tribe to the contrary and/or previously enacted by the Tribe.
